text: This looks like a good start, a pretty challenge shot to start off on to be honest. It looks like you need to animate a grade on your patch so that it is a bit darker at the start and then back to normal on your reference frame as I can your patch standing out as his shadows make the lighting change on the cupboard behind him. Also make sure to denoise before you do any work as when you framehold you get static grain in your patch

Then after the BG looks good you've got the tricky work of rebuilding the guy.  Because of the perspective change you probably need to paint up about 3 frames and track them in then dissolve between them all to try match the perspective, you'll probably need to do quite a bit of warping on your patches to, as this will be difficult to match
Out of interest where are you at with your education and where/what are you studying?
